author: louissealey1
title: Alexandre Pato admits Chelsea striker Diego Costa would be a welcome addition in China
text:
Diego Costa has been linked with a move to China (Picture: Getty) Alexandre Pato admits Chelsea striker Diego Costa would be a welcome addition to the Tianjin Quanjian squad.
Spain international Costa has been strongly linked with a move to the Chinese Super League since January, when he reportedly fell out with Antonio Conte.
Germany 1-0 England player ratings: Lallana and Alli shine as Podolski ends on a high Both Conte and Costa have played down the incident but the 28-year-old’s future at Stamford Bridge has still come under scrutiny in recent weeks.
And Pato, who spent a brief loan spell at Chelsea in 2016, insists Costa would bolster Tianjin Quanjian’s squad.
‘I already played with Diego Costa at Chelsea. He is a good teammate, he could help us a lot,’ Brazil international Pato told Marca.
‘But I know nothing [about his possible arrival]. What I think is that this summer we will sign an important, world-class player.
Alexandre Pato joined the Chinese Super League in January (Picture: Getty) More: Football Arsenal superstar opens talks with European club over summer transfer

‘I do not know [if it would be Costa]. I just play. Fabio Cannavaro and the president are the ones who deal with these things. I am honest.
‘I only know that right now the foreign players that we are in the team are me, Axel Witsel, Geuvanio, Junior Moraes and Kwon Kyun-won. These are the ones we can play now.’
